prTitle: feat: validate and fix HTML5 compliance for spaghetti website
prBody:
## Summary

Validated and corrected HTML5 compliance for issue #4 - Simple Spaghetti Website.

### Changes Made
1. **Fixed HTML content**: Changed text from "I love pizza" to "I love spagheeti" (with intentional spelling)
2. **Removed CSS violations**: Eliminated all inline CSS styling (`style` attributes)
3. **Removed unnecessary elements**: Removed styled footer element 
4. **Updated page title**: Changed from "Test Pizza Page" to "Simple Spaghetti Website"
5. **Created validation script**: Added comprehensive HTML5 compliance test script

### Validation Results
✅ **W3C HTML5 Validator**: Document validates successfully
✅ **File size**: 125 bytes (well under 1KB requirement)
✅ **No CSS styling**: Complies with FR-004 requirement
✅ **No JavaScript**: Complies with FR-005/FR-007 requirements
✅ **Proper HTML5 structure**: Valid DOCTYPE, html, head, body elements
✅ **Required text**: Contains exact text "I love spagheeti" as specified

### Files Changed
- `index.html`: Updated to meet all functional requirements (FR-001 through FR-008)
- `validate_html.sh`: New validation script implementing test plan from LLD.md section 9

### Test Results
All 8 validation tests pass:
- File existence and size validation
- Content verification (required text present)
- CSS/JavaScript prohibition compliance 
- HTML5 structure validation
- W3C HTML5 validation (with only non-blocking lang attribute warning)

Closes #4
